content.description: Sit start at Jug or Not and traverse left to finish up Man of Steel.
Start as for Jug or Not, trend left as for Speeding bullet, but continue on to Flex Luthor and finish up through the roof as for that climb.
content.protection: Multiple pads, its a pretty long problem and the top out is over a pretty rocky area.
content.location: Starting at the lowest point in the Fortress of Solitude. Where Jug or Not starts, but trending left instead of up

content.description: Start at bottom of slab to the right of Lois' Lane. Reach up to roof jugs and traverse left till hands matched on crystal jug. Top out same as Lane for (V2+) variant.
content.location: Far right side of Fortress of Solitude.

content.description: Sit start on good holds, as for Lois Lane Sit, in the middle of the face on the right side of the Fortress of Solitude. Traverse left through a series of crimps around head height, as for Kal-el extension, and then continue on around the corner along the rail of good edges/jugs with excellent feet all around, used for jug or not, until you can go straight through the roof on crimps, as for man of steel/speeding bullet, to an easy rock-over mantle finish.
content.protection: Several pads as this climb traverses most of the cave and tops out over the worst landing in the cave.
content.location: Starting on the ride side of the Fortress of Solitude on the face. This climb shares the same start with Lois Lane Sit, the obvious holds at waist height in the middle of the face.

content.description:
This description "Sit start down in the hole on good hold climb up and left to the blade rockover finish." does not match #2 in the beta photo.  This tells you to go in the wrong direction.

 It should be closer to " Start in the middle of the roof on a good hold, above and left of the start to Flex Luthor, trend-right along the shelf, past flex Luthor, until you can move up through holds in the roof to the blade rockover finish that is shared with Speeding Bullet.
A cool sit start, one move wonder, finish as for Lois Lane.
Stand start, follow good holds and topout as for Jal-el/Kal-el.
content.location: right side of wall, #9 on the beta photo

content.description: Sit start right of Kal-el and move slightly right to good hold at lip.  Make a big move from good hold to some harder face moves.  Topout either straight up or to the left.
Sit start way to the right and traverse left to join Kal-el under the lip encounter.
Sit start on right side of arête climb up to a hard lip encounter.
Sit start, follow good holds to dirty slot finish.
Sit start on left side of arête similar to Jug or Not, make one long move then move up to face right of dirty slot to an interesting finish.
Left side of big cave.  #1 on topo photo.

Initially an attempt on the Project V8 (#3 in photo), ended up following a great line of its own over the roof. Sit start matched at the lowest point and move up and slightly left, gaining an OK crimp under the roof (crux). Move out to the jug from General Zod (#1 in photo) and throw to lip, finishing (based on photo) left of Man of Steel (#2 in photo).
content.protection: Several pads and ideally two spotters. The move to the top out can swing the climber well away from the boulder.
content.location: Starts below #3 in the beta photo, and then moves up and left, finishing between #1 and #2.

content.description: Sit start on the holds of Lois Lane Sit. Traverse to the left through the crimps of the Kal-El extension, around the corner on jugs, until you can finish through the crux of Flex Luthor.  Almost felt like more of a sport climb (minus rope) than a boulder. Embrace the pump!
content.protection: Several Pads. Tops out over the rocky part when you might be pretty pumped
content.location: On the right-side face of the Fortress of Solitude. Same start as Lois Lane Sit, Kal-El extension, and Metallo with decent holds about belly-button height.

content.description: Hard sit start in the cave, shared with Flex Luthor, climb up and trend-right along the shelf at head-height on good holds and continue on up through crimps in the roof, as for Man of Steel/Speeding Bullet, to an easy rock-over mantle to finish the climb.
Steepest rock in the area with some great problems.
